title: Education Relationship Type Vocabulary
description: Domain-specific refinement of CEP relationship types for education institutions, programs, people, and credentials.

terms.label: Institution Offers Program
terms.definition: A relationship where an education institution offers or is responsible for delivering a specific program or course of study.

terms.label: Institution Runs Course Instance
terms.definition: A relationship where an institution organizes or schedules a particular course instance or class offering.

terms.label: Person Enrolled in Program
terms.definition: A relationship where a person is enrolled as a learner in a specific education program, course of study, or pathway.

terms.label: Person Enrolled in Course Instance
terms.definition: A relationship where a person is enrolled in a specific course instance, section, or class offering during a defined term or period.

terms.label: Person Teaches Course Instance
terms.definition: A relationship where a person acts as teacher or instructor for a specific course instance or class offering.

terms.label: Person Holds Credential
terms.definition: A relationship where a person has been awarded a credential, degree, certificate, or license by an institution or authority.

terms.label: Institution Accredited by Body
terms.definition: A relationship where an institution is accredited, approved, or recognized by an accreditation body or regulatory authority.

terms.label: Other Education Relationship
terms.definition: An education-related relationship type that does not fit another, more specific category in this vocabulary but is needed to represent source systems.
